ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Help
ygData.msgSnippet: Yeah, it may just be random. I talked to someone who had a problem with his bank and after only having his account cancelled for one month came back to
ygData.messageBody:
Yeah, it may just be random. I talked to someone who had a problem with his
bank and after only having his account cancelled for one month came back to
discover all his gear gone. Could've been bc of servers going down with
problems and such. Or the guy could've been making it up..
luv,
-Su
>
> Not really trying to argue here but I have canceled my account 3
different times for RL things. Granted, the longest time I was away was only
4 months. But when I logged back on, all was well. Nothing moved, no gear
missing... I litterally did pick up where I left off.
> Maybe accounts that go inactive for a year or more can have problems
though.
> Su <suceress@...> wrote:
> > > Second off, old accounts can NOT be reactivated just like that.
> > > EverQuest holds onto your unused and unpaid for accounts for six
> > > months before deleting it.
> > No, they guarantee they won't delete accounts for 6 months, but they
> > have never yet actually deleted an inactive account. I know of several
> > people who have returned after a year or more and just reactivated their
> > account
> > Matt
> >
> Well, I have heard reports of people having their gear and money deleted
> while their characters and levels were still there. So there's no
guarantee
> that you can just pick up where you left off.
> luv,
> -Su
>
